intro: Gilibertia iriomotensis, commonly known as the Iriomote gilbertia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Iriomote in Japan. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gilibertia iriomotensis is considered a vulnerable species.
